data.enText: separate
to separate or make sth separate into parts
The cells began to divide rapidly.

data.chText: 一个句子可以划分成有意义的各个部分。
data.enText: A sentence can be divided up into meaningful segments.
to separate sth into parts and give a share to each of a number of different people, etc.

data.chText: 杰克把余下的现金分了。
data.enText: Jack divided up the rest of the cash.

data.chText: 我们共同分担这项工作。
data.enText: We divided the work between us.

data.chText: 把（时间、精力等）分别用于
data.enText: to use different parts of your time, energy, etc. for different activities, etc.

data.chText: 他把精力一部分用在政治上，一部分用在生意上。
data.enText: He divides his energies between politics and business.
to separate two people or things

data.chText: 让母子分离难道还有对的时候？
data.enText: Can it ever be right to divide a mother from her child?

data.chText: 是…的分界线；分隔；把…隔开
data.enText: to be the real or imaginary line or barrier that separates two people or things

data.chText: 篱笆把庭院的西面隔开。
data.enText: A fence divides off the western side of the grounds.
to separate into two parts that lead in different directions
Where the path divides, keep right.
cause disagreement

data.chText: 使产生分歧；使意见不一
data.enText: to make two or more people disagree

data.chText: 这个问题在政府中引起了意见分歧。
data.enText: The issue has divided the government.
mathematics
to find out how many times one number is contained in another
30 divided by 6 is 5 (30 ÷ 6 = 5) .
to be able to be multiplied to give another number
5 divides into 30 6 times.
divide and rule
to keep control over people by making them disagree with and fight each other, therefore not giving them the chance to unite and oppose you together
a policy of divide and rule
difference
a difference between two groups of people that separates them from each other
the North/South divide

data.chText: 北爱尔兰的天主教徒和新教徒之间的分歧
data.enText: the divide between Catholics and Protestants in Northern Ireland
between rivers
a line of high land that separates two systems of rivers

simple_means.memory_skill: di 使…分开，离开 + vid 分开 + e → 分开

means: 把(时间、精力等)分别用于

ex.chText: 请将批阅完的考卷按及格和不及格分开。
ex.enText: Please separate the marked examination papers into passes and fails.

ex.chText: 这两个社区被一条狭窄的街道隔开。
ex.enText: The two communities are separated by a narrow street.

ex.chText: 她把4个鸡蛋的蛋清和蛋黄分开。
ex.enText: She separated the whites and yolks of 4 eggs.

synonyms.bx: 指将混合物按不同类别分开，也指把紧连在一起或溶合在一起的东西分开。

ex.chText: 这条河把我的果园和他的果园隔开了。
ex.enText: The river divides my orchard from his.

ex.chText: 这个苹果被分成了4等份。
ex.enText: This cake is divided into four equal parts.

ex.chText: 老师把全班分成5个小组。
ex.enText: The teacher divided the class into five groups.

synonyms.bx: 指把两个区域分隔开，或将一个整体分为若干部分，有时含平均划分之意。

ex.chText: 把道德责任和政治责任分隔开来是错误的。
ex.enText: It is wrong to isolate moral responsibility from political responsibility.

ex.chText: 这个村子因洪水而与外界隔绝。
ex.enText: The village was isolated by the flood.

ex.chText: 传染病患者应予以隔离。
ex.enText: People with contagious diseases should be isolated.

ex.chText: 执政党内的激进派坚持主张从政治上孤立该国。
ex.enText: The radical group in the ruling party insisted upon isolating the country politically.

synonyms.bx: 指区别看待问题、观点等，也指使人或物处于孤立、隔离的状态。

ex.enText: She parts her hair in the middle.
The crowd parted to let the police car through.
She hated being parted from the children.
She has parted from her husband.

synonyms.bx: 多指使紧密相连的人或物分开，指父母和子女分开时多用被动语态。

data.enText: divide and rule
to keep control over people by making them disagree with and fight each other, therefore not giving them the chance to unite and oppose you together
a policy of divide and rule

tr: a ridge of land that separates two adjacent river systems
a serious disagreement between two groups of people (typically producing tension or hostility)

example: The two pieces that we had glued separated
divide the cake into three equal parts
The British carved up the Ottoman Empire after World War I
The mountain range divides the two countries

value.def: When people or things are divided or divide into smaller groups or parts, they become separated into smaller parts.

example.ex: The physical benefits of exercise can be divided into three factors...
example.tran: 运动对身体的好处可以分为3个方面。

example.ex: It will be easiest if we divide them into groups...
example.tran: 如果我们将他们分成小组将是最简单的。

example.ex: Divide the pastry in half and roll out each piece...
example.tran: 把油酥面团一分为二，再分别擀成皮。

example.ex: We divide into pairs and each pair takes a region...
example.tran: 我们分成两人一组，每一组负责一个区域。

example.ex: Bacteria reproduce by dividing and making copies of themselves.
example.tran: 细菌通过分裂和自我复制来繁殖。

value.def: If you divide something among people or things, you separate it into several parts or quantities which you distribute to the people or things.

example.ex: Paul divides most of his spare time between the study and his bedroom...
example.tran: 保罗在大部分空闲时间里要么呆在书房里，要么呆在卧室里。
把酱汁分到 4 个碗里。

value.def: If you divide a larger number by a smaller number or divide a smaller number into a larger number, you calculate how many times the smaller number can fit exactly into the larger number.

example.ex: Measure the floor area of the greenhouse and divide it by six.
example.tran: 量一下温室的建筑面积再将它除以 6。

value.def: If a border or line divides two areas or divides an area into two, it keeps the two areas separate from each other.

example.ex: ...remote border areas dividing Tamil and Muslim settlements.
example.tran: 将泰米尔聚居区和穆斯林聚居区隔开的偏远边境地区

example.ex: ...the artificial line that divides the city.
example.tran: 划分城市的人为分界线

example.ex: ...the long frontier dividing Mexico from the United States.
example.tran: 墨西哥和美国之间绵长的边界线

value.tran: 分隔;把…分开;是…的分界线

value.def: If people divide over something or if something divides them, it causes strong disagreement between them.

example.ex: She has done more to divide the Conservatives than anyone else...
example.tran: 她在分裂保守党这件事上所起的作用比任何人都大。

example.ex: The democrats are divided over whether to admit him into their group...
example.tran: 民主党人就是否允许他加入他们的组织意见不一。

example.ex: The party is likely to divide along ideological lines.
example.tran: 该党有可能在意识形态上产生分歧。

value.def: A divide is a significant distinction between two groups, often one that causes conflict.

example.ex: ...a deliberate attempt to create a Hindu-Muslim divide in India.
example.tran: 故意在印度的印度教徒和穆斯林之间制造分歧的企图

value.tran: 明显差异;(常指引起争论的)分歧

value.def: A divide is a moment in time or a point in a process when there is a complete change from one situation to another.

example.ex: The time had come to cross the great divide between formality and truth.
example.tran: 是时候跨越形式与真理之间的巨大分界线了。

value.def: A divide is a line of high ground between areas that are drained by different rivers.

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 watershed

value.def: You use divide and rule to refer to a policy which is intended to keep someone in a position of power by causing disagreements between people who might otherwise unite against them.

example.ex: The government's policies of divide and rule have only contributed to the volatility of the region.
example.tran: 政府分而治之的政策只是加剧了该地区的不稳定性。

trans: 分治算法；分治法；分治；分而治之；分治策略
分裂成派系而自我削弱

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 做… + vis 看 + e → 使〔别人〕看到 → 劝告
ad 做… + vis 看 + ory …的 → 劝告的
en 使… + vis 看 + age 表行为 → 看 → 想象
e 出 + vid 看 + ence 性质，状态，行为 → 证据
e 出 + vid 看 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 看出来了 → 明显的
im 不 + provident 深谋远虑的 → 没有远见的，有钱就花 → 浪费的
in 使… + vid 看 + ious …的 → 让人看 →〔易〕招嫉妒的
pre 预先 + vis 看 + e → 预先看 → 预知
pro 在前 + vid 看 + e → 提前看好 → 预备
pro 向前 + vid 看 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 向前看的 → 有远见的 → 深谋远虑的
pro 向前 + vision 眼界 + al …的 → 眼前的 → 临时的
re 一再 + vis 看 + e → 一看再看 → 一改再改 → 修正
re 一再 + vis 看 + ion，revise 的名词 → 修正；校订本
super 上 + vis 看 + e → 在上面看 → 监督
vis 看 + ible 可…的 → 可见的
vis 看 + ion 表名词 → 视力；眼界
vision 视力；眼界 + ary …的 → 幻想的
vis 看 + ual 有…性质的 → 视力的
visual 视力的 + ize …化 → 使〔大家〕看到 → 使具体化
de 加强 + vis 分开 + e → 由古义“分开”转化而来
di 二 + vid 分开 + e → 一分为二 → 分开
di 二，两 + vis 分开 + ion 表名词 → 分开
di 二，两 + vid 分开 + end 表抽象名词 → 一变二，二变多 → 股息
in 不 + di 二，两 + vid 分开 + ual 有…性质的 → 不能分开的 → 个人的
di 二，两 + lapid 石头 + ate 使… →〔造房的〕石头一分为二 → 倒塌
di 二，两 + lemma 争论 → 争论有两种 → 进退两难
di 二，两 + ox 氧 + ide 化合物 → 二氧化物
di 使…分开，离开 + gest 带来 → 带下去 → 消化 → 经过消化后的精华 → 文摘
di 使…分开，离开 + gest 带来 → 带下去 → 消化
di 使…分开，离开 + gress 走 → 离开〔话题〕→ 离题
di 使…分开，离开 + lat 放 + e → 分开放 → 膨胀
di 使…分开，离开 + lut 冲洗 + e →〔用水〕冲洗使分开 → 冲淡
di 使…分开，离开 + vert 转 → 转开 → 转向
di 使…分开，离开 + vest 衣服 → 衣服与身体分离 → 脱去
di 使…分开，离开 + vid 分开 + e → 分开
di 使…分开，离开 + vorc〔 = vert转〕+ e → 从〔丈夫〕身边转开 → 离婚
